newsitem.title: USA: Laclede Steel profits from cost reductions.
newsitem.headline: Laclede Steel profits from cost reductions.

text.p: Laclede Steel Co said Thursday that cost reductions carried out late last year helped post a profit in the first quarter.

The steel processing company reported net income of $135,000, or $0.01 a share, compared with a loss of $2.0 million, or $0.50, one year ago. Sales in the period were $80.8 million, compared to $81.0 million in the first quarter of 1996.
Laclede said the latest results also included an after-tax gain of $592,0000 from the sale of its electric weld structural and mechanical tubing operation.
The company also said the effect of recently announced price increases for its steel pipe and bars have yet to be determined.
Laclede shares were off 1/4 Thursday at 4-3/8.
